The breakfast has everything you could want, yoghurts, fresh fruits, cheeses, cold cuts, cereals, pastries, eggs juices, tea, coffee etc., much better than expected.

reviews.text: I have been doubting between very good and excellent in this review. Finnaly, I have decided the Arosfa Hotel deserves an excellent. Let you tell you why:
reviews.title: WYSIWYG - What you see is what you get

reviews.text: The Arosfa plays in the so to speak "Small hotels in a house in London" league. You find a lot of this kind around Victoria Station, near Earls Court or, in this case, in Bloomsbury. In fact, many times you could miss the entrance to your hotel and finish in another one as they are lined one besides the other in the same street. Inside: Same thing too: A reception, living area in the ground floor, breakfast room in the basement and rooms scattered in any corner or the first, second and sometimes third floor. They are usually in the cheap side of the scale and include breakfast in the rate. So, what make Arosfa different?
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: There are three things in my opinion. First is good taste, in the very nice living room, almost the same you could fine in many boutique hotels, in the rooms decoration... Second, practicality; I was in a single room and even it was really small, you had everything you need: a nice bed, good shower, wifi, a nice TV with plenty of channels. And third, and most important, service: It is not only the hotel is full of details, from fresh fruit in your room to cookies in the living room, and coffee and tea in both. it is that these people seem to care about their customers, they seem to listen - as in my case - to your concerns when making a reservation ("You asked for a quiet room and you were worried about the wifi signal"). Simple, yes but, why don't hotels do this?. The guys in Arosfa do it.
reviews.title: Warm, Wonderful, Well located and tasteful. A Gem.

reviews.text: Expect a nice room, small (that`s common in London), clean (not so common), a filling breakfast (included ni the rate even in the english version) and nice and attentive staff at a very good price and situation in London and you won't be dissapointed. I was not.
reviews.title: Amazing Arosfa!

reviews.text: We stayed 2 nights with 3 adults and 3 kids (10, 7 and 7) in their apartment setup which is a locked off area with 2 bedrooms and a common bathroom. One of the rooms has a small kitchen in it. It was very clean and very comfortable. Breakfast in the mornings was great. You could have a traditional English breakfast or opt for cereal and pastries. The owners were very helpful and friendly. It's about a 10-15 min walk to the British Museum and St. Pancras or King's Cross Station or about a 5 min walk to Goodge street tube station. It was also nice to have free access to a computer. We would certainly stay here again!
reviews.title: Great hotel and a great location.

reviews.text: If you read all of the reviews then you have an idea of what to expect. The rooms my daughter and I had were small, cozy, snug and incredibly clean. What we didn't expect were to find personalized, handwritten Easter cards with chocolates left in each of our rooms for Easter and this was really a nice touch. The wonderful smell of breakfast wafting up from the restaurant in the morning was better than any alarm clock. If i could have changed anything it would have been to have a firmer bed and maybe a bit more water pressure inthe bathroom, but this is totally subjective on my part.
reviews.title: Like a home away from home

reviews.text: My young daughter and I stayed for 3 nights in a family room, which was very nice for us but would probably be quite cramped if there were another adult and child also in it. Very clean, very quiet, helpful and friendly staff, excellent nights sleep, nice breakfast, great location. No complaints and would definitely revisit and recommend.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money - clean and homely.

reviews.text: I stayed in Arosfa for one week in a double room, and I must admit that everything with that hotel was great , from clean rooms and very suitable location to a very welcoming personel and great breakfast !
reviews.title: Best for Location and Value!
tiny room in lovely B&B
reviews.text: I slept in the tiniest room ever, which was probably their best solution for a single room. Otherwise the staff, service and location was great.

Perfect for a short break. Rooms very small but attractive and spotlessly clean. Within walking distance of many attractions and theatres but also close to Tube stations. Staff very friendly and helpful. We thought it was good value for money.
reviews.title: A little gem...

reviews.text: Out of so many hotels in London we had chosen the Arosfa due to its overall excellent critics and we were not disappointed at all. On the contrary, we felt welcome, comfortable and liked a lot the newly refurbished rooms. OK, the bathrooms are tiny but at least clean and if you look at the prices I would say this is really very good value for money compared to other hotels in London - in this price range most of them are dreadful! The location is superb, three tube stations in walking distance and even a bus stop in opposite of the hotel. I will definitely come back!
reviews.title: Very good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My hubby and I just got back from a Christmas holiday in London. Stayed here for 5 nights. Atilla and Tessa are great, and immediately made us feel at home. There is nothing too difficult for them to do, in order to make their guests comfortable. We got room - upgrading after 2 nights and moved to the top floor apartment which is huge and beautiful. In addition, location is good and breakfast is fabulous. Do not hesitated choosing this hotel!
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.text: Yes, the beds and bathrooms are tiny at this property; however, you can't beat this place for the value, the location, and the friendliness of the owners. The plentiful and diverse breakfast is alone with the cost! Also, the Googe tube station is just a few minutes away, and you can walk to the theatres and British Museum. Although the rooms are small, they have everything you could possibly need and that you would find in much more pricey places like hair dryers and loaner umbrellas. There is also a nice lounge area with a few computers and tea/water/books. In a city like London, you won't be spending much time in your room anyway, so the small room really shouldn't be much of a turn-off.
reviews.title: Excellent Value in London

reviews.text: The service from the hostcouple couldn`t be better. My room was very small, especially the bathroom, but it was all functioning well and was clean, so I liked it. The room was att the gardenside and it was quiet. There was only steps, byt you didn`t need to care for how to get your luggage up and down because the owners allready have done what was needed. For breakfast you could get what you want of normal food and it was included in the price, for exampel full english breakfast. Wi-fi in the house and internet in the diningroom is free and functioning. The hosts lived in the hotel themselves, so it was a "safe" place. Even the streets leading to the two underground stations nearby and the nearest way to Trafalgar square was safe to walk in the evening, I felt. Walking to Trafalgar takes 22 minuts.

reviews.text: I don't really want to share how pleasant this place was, because I intend to go again, and don't want it to be booked out. One of the firends I was staying with had abirthday that fell on the arrival day, and when I inquired about arranging flowers the staff insisted on fixing everything. They arranged complimentary chocolates and flowers. How about that for service? 11/10 for staff: Friendly, obliging and helpful.
reviews.title: A home away from home!

reviews.text: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay while visiting our daughter attending university in London. Tessa and Atila are wonderful hosts, making one feel right at home instantly. Nothing seems to be too much trouble to ensure that their guests have a pleasant stay. The rooms are well maintained, exceptionally clean, updated, and comfortable. The location is exceptional, easy access to the tube, and within easy walking distance to a multitude of restaurants and shops. With the well prepared cooked breakfast, we were ready to start our day. Counting down the days until we return to this lovely place!

The breakfast was good with friendly service. This is where I plan to stay when visiting London again.
